@Variety @BarbraStreisand Speaking from personal experience, I have seen female dogs breed and breed until they're bodies cannot handle it anymore. You can go and buy a certain breed from a breeder, you have that choice. You can rescue from a shelter. Why clone a dog you already have?

@Variety @BarbraStreisand When a dog is cloned it requires a surrogate mother to be devoloped in. The company that clones the dogs "rescue" female dogs to become said surrogates. Even if the company gives the dog everything it needs, female dogs can die from over breeding. Is it really worth it?

@tiptoe2810 @Variety @BarbraStreisand Hi! A single clone needs about a hundred surrogate animals who are all kept in poor conditions and often produce clones who are born suffering from birth defects. Also, it is unlikely your animals clone would have the same personality whatsoever. https://t.co/ejya8QI72x https://t.co/GCOgf4YXkV

@JanJancraig17 @TantraMaat @Variety @BarbraStreisand Through an extremely invasive and often painful process of using hundreds of surrogate animals just to get a single clone!
https://t.co/ejya8QI72x
@lisaraestine @Variety @BarbraStreisand There’s also the myth that cloning your animal will give them the same personality, unfortunately this isn’t true. https://t.co/daaA8bUWq6

@KimLawUhcl @SeanMaeder @Variety @BarbraStreisand No, cloning doesn't work like that. Cloning involves removing the genetic material from a fertilized egg and replacing it with genetic material from the clone-host. The egg is then gestated in a mother of the same species and born like the rest of us. Cloned beef would cost same.
